net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component

Class ButtonDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.ComponentDisplay
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.ButtonDisplay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, HTMLClassifier
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CollapsibleContainerDisplay, TabItemDisplay

    @ConfigurableObject
public class ButtonDisplay
extends ComponentDisplay
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    The ButtonDisplay class holds display values for a button, such as the label, images, etc. The unselectedImage and unselectedImageInactive images are the default image whether the button has a selection state or not.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) TextSource confirmText
      If not null, the message displayed with a OK/Cancel option before the action is fired.
      (package private) TextSource description
      The description for the button
      (package private) TextSource disabledText
      The message displayed when the user clicks a disabled button.
      (package private) TextSource label
      The label for the button
      (package private) Image pressedImage
      The image when the button is pressed.
      (package private) Image pressedImageInactive
      Same meaning as pressedImage, but used when inactive/disabled.

      Property name for the confirmation text.

      Property name for the rollover image.

      Property name for the inactive rollover image.
      static java.lang.String PROP_SELECTEDIMAGE
      Property name for the selected image.

      Property name for the inactive unselected image.
      (package private) Image rolloverImage
      The image when the mouse is over the button.
      (package private) Image rolloverImageInactive
      Same meaning as rolloverImage, but used when inactive/disabled.
      (package private) Image selectedImage
      The image when the button is selected.
      (package private) Image selectedImageInactive
      Same meaning as selectedImage, but used when inactive/disabled.
      (package private) Dimension size
      The size of the button.
      (package private) Image unselectedImage
      The image when the button is unselected, this is the image used for button without a selection state as well.
      (package private) Image unselectedImageInactive
      Same meaning as unselectedImage, but used when inactive/disabled.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ButtonDisplay()
      Creates a ButtonDisplay will all null values.
      ButtonDisplay(java.lang.String text)
      Creates a ButtonDisplay with a label, no images.
      ButtonDisplay(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String description)
      Creates a ButtonDisplay with a label and description, no images.
      ButtonDisplay(java.lang.String text, java.lang.String description, Image unselectedImage)
      Creates a ButtonDisplay with a label and description, no images.
      ButtonDisplay(TextSource label)
      Creates a ButtonDisplay with a label, no images.
      ButtonDisplay(TextSource label, Image unselectedImage)
      Creates a ButtonDisplay with a label, and one image.
      ButtonDisplay(TextSource label, Image unselectedImage, Image selectedImage, Image rolloverImage)
      Creates a ButtonDisplay with a label, and all images.
      ButtonDisplay(TextSource label, TextSource description, Image unselectedImage)
      Creates a ButtonDisplay with a label, and one image.
      ButtonDisplay(TextSource label, TextSource description, Image unselectedImage, Image selectedImage, Image rolloverImage)
      Creates a ButtonDisplay with a label, and all images.

        Overrides:
        clone in class ComponentDisplay

      • getConfirmText

        public TextSource getConfirmText()
        Get the text that is displayed after the button is clicked and before the action is fired. If not null the user is given the option to cancel the action.
        Returns:
        text or null.

      • getDescription

        public TextSource getDescription()
        Get the description for the button.
        Returns:
        text or null.

      • getDisabledText

        public TextSource getDisabledText()
        Get the text displayed when a disabled button is clicked. The default is medium dependant.
        Returns:
        text or null.

      • getLabel

        public TextSource getLabel()
        Get the label for the button.
        Returns:
        text or null.

        Returns:
        Image

      • getSelectedImage

        public Image getSelectedImage()
        Get the selected image. Normally for buttons with a selection state, images are only used if both an unselected and selected image are set.
        Returns:
        Image or null.

      • getSelectedInactiveImage

        public Image getSelectedInactiveImage()
        Returns the selectedImageInactive.
        Returns:
        Image

      • getSize

        public Dimension getSize()
        Get the size of the button.
        Returns:
        Dimension or null to let the medium decide the size.

      • getUnselectedImage

        public Image getUnselectedImage()
        Get the unselected image, also the image used for buttons that have no selection state.
        Returns:
        Image or null.

      • getUnselectedInactiveImage

        public Image getUnselectedInactiveImage()
        Returns the unselectedImageInactive.
        Returns:
        Image

      • setConfirmText

        @ConfigurationOption
public void setConfirmText(@Nullable
                                                TextSource confirmText)
        Set the text that is displayed after the button is clicked and before the action is fired. If not null the user is given the option to cancel the action.
        Parameters:
        confirmText - text, null to disable.

        Set the description for the button.
        Parameters:
        l - The description, may be null.

      • setDisabledText

        public void setDisabledText(TextSource disabledText)
        Set the text displayed when a disabled button is clicked. The default is medium dependant.

        disabledText - text, null to disable.

      • setSelectedImage

        public void setSelectedImage(Image i)
        Set the selected image. Normally for buttons with a selection state, images are only used if both an unselected and selected image are set.
        Parameters:
        i - The selected image or null.
